854057607:
[

Support Specialist

Company Name Marketplacer Company Location South Melbourne, Victoria, Australia

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 89 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

About Us

Marketplacer is one of the world’s leading online marketplace platforms, with clients including Bob Jane T-Marts, Myer and Jayco. The Product Development Team at Marketplacer is responsible for creating and operating our innovative platform for marketplace websites.


Role Responsibilities

The Support Analyst is the first point of contact for businesses using the Marketplacer platform. As the Support Analyst, you will be responsible for:


  • Liaising with business owners, account managers and members of the Product Development Team to deliver solutions to our customers

  • Operating within the support team to develop processes to increase customer satisfaction

  • Prioritising new defects and existing queries raised by marketplace businesses

  • Collaborate with Product and Development teams to analyse new features requested by existing customers.

  • Communicating the status of defects and queries back to the requestor

  • Taking ownership of customer issues to ensure that queries are either resolved or acknowledged in a timely manner

  • Maintaining historical records and related problem documentation for future reference

  • Documenting new and existing features and create how-to guides for marketplace businesses, allowing them to utilise the full suite of platform features

  • Assisting with communicating and coordinating the release of new platform features

  • Develop and implement initiatives to improve customer services

  • Assisting the Onboarding Team with data entry, research and support


While not a technical role, it does require an understanding of digital businesses, with the ability to learn the features and functions of a technology platform.


About You

To succeed in the role, you will be comfortable starting and building sustainable relationships through outstanding customer service.


  • You are the ultimate communicator

  • You are a born listener and problem solver

  • You love process and thrive and maintaining a high level of attention to detail

  • You are excited to help retail businesses overcome the challenges of connecting to customers online

  • You are an expert multi-tasker that can prioritise your duties

  • Most importantly, you bring a contagious enthusiasm to work every day!


Key Skills and Qualifications

  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills

  • Ability to prioritise and manage multiple competing demands

  • Experience in a B2B customer service role, ideally working with senior stakeholders and managing their expectations

  • Ability to collaborate with other internal departments

  • Experience in eCommerce

  • Prior experience working with a customer facing role at a SaaS company highly regarded

  • Tertiary qualification highly regarded


Why Join Marketplacer?

Apart from joining an enthusiastic team of like-minded people, as the Support Analyst for Marketplacer, we can offer you:


  • Attractive salary package

  • All equipment is provided including computer and office workstation

  • Full-time position reporting to the Customer Support Lead

  • Convenient location in South Melbourne, near the freeway and public transport


If you can make this role your own, then tell us why. Let us know what special skill you will bring to the team at Marketplacer!

Job description

Joining Belimo as a Sales Estimator, you will take on an exciting role of increasing sales potential by estimiating projects with the BELIMO products.\xa0\xa0


You will be working collaboratively within a team environment and building strong client relationships. As a Sales Estimator, you will be bringing your expertise to:


  • Manage the tender process and take-offs until the successful acquisition of each project.
  • Coordinate with inter-departments in order to fulfil customer project requirements.
  • Project quoting directly or through online portals as required.
  • Documenting and analysing data to assist future tenders.


The successful applicant will possess the following characteristics:


  • Experience in tendering/project management experience in a similar field.

  • Exceptional communication skills (both written and verbal) and the ability to interact at all levels.

  • Team player who is also proactive and has a creative and solutions focused approach.

  • Attention to detail and proficiency with computers.

  • Highly organised though adaptable to change.

    \xa0

This position is ideal for a candidate with Sales experience and / or a Graduate Engineer.


If you are looking for a career that will take you further, this is your opportunity.

My client is urgently looking for a Network Engineer to join their team in Melbourne. Please share your resumes/referrals at anil.more@itbility.com.au



Required Skills:


      • You must be an experienced IT Systems Engineer, an excellent communicator and passionate about delivering a high level of service to all users.
      • Extensive experience in MS Infrastructure - Windows Server (2008/2012/2016).
        Solid Active Directory, Group Policy,.
        Impressive understanding of networking and voice.
      • Experience in Network Domain (Data/Wireless) - LAN/WAN R&S.

      • Should have experience in Telecommunications Network Operations and IT operations
      • Operations and delivery network improvement and business operations
      • Experience in End to End Process design and development and network operations
      • Utilize network tools that monitor utilization, predict capacity requirements, and manage inventory and configuration.




    All applicants should have full working rights in Australia

853670925:
[

UX Lead

Company Name Loud & Clear Company Location 83 William Street , Melbourne, VIC 3000, AU

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 57 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Description:\xa0


Loud&Clear is a team of over 175 digital natives who love building future-ready businesses.

We do this by combining design thinking, data-driven insights and well-drilled development capabilities to build products and platforms that inspire and capture imagination.

\xa0

The sort of work we love doing is:

  • UX, CX and customer-centred design for tier one enterprises
  • React Native apps for global clients and funded startups
  • Sitecore and Acquia websites with a particular focus on retail and commerce
  • Digital Strategy and Transformations
  • Chatbot powered experiences and AI


The sort of work we don't do is:

  • EDMs and banner ads
  • Retainer campaign work
  • Social media


We are looking for an UX Lead to join our team.


Requirements:


  • I have at least 5 years of experience working in fast paced environment for digital agencies.
  • I lead UX projects and more junior members of the team when they are engaged in my projects. I drive the agency philosophy of ‘make something people love’ within the team and critically evaluate the quality of the output of the team.
  • I actively seek to find opportunities for the agency, whether it’s through identifying opportunities in prospective clients or opportunities to extend engagements with existing clients.
  • I am seen as a leader in my field, and am active in the UX community. This is executed through public speaking, teaching, and thought leadership.
  • I am endlessly curious about my craft and all aspects of User Experience, I pursue knowledge in emerging trends and technology and identify opportunities to deliver better customer experiences for the clients I work with.
  • I facilitate UX, Discovery, CX, Service Design and HCD workshops for our clients, and actively look to up-skill my team to run these too.
  • I support the UX practice lead in creating an outstanding professional environment for the XD team and our teams clients. This means I understand what high-quality UX consultancy looks like, and the tools and methodologies we use to deliver. \xa0
  • I am an 80% billable resource across multiple projects as a lead consultant and equipped with the expertise to deliver all aspects of a UX project on the required tools.
  • I am able to identify, workshop and manage up operational, and delivery issues within the projects I’m engaged in.

Mortgage Broker

Company Name Mortgage Choice Croydon & Melbourne CBD Company Location Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 23 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

The Organisation

This organisation is a well established family business that is ethical, credible, professional and is trusted by the local community. The business owners are motivated and driven individuals who are looking for a like minded person to join the team. They are very passionate about growing and developing their city franchise business and will ensure a win/win culture and positive work enviornment. It’s this mentality that has helped them become trusted and regarded brokers within the industry.


The Opportunity
Due to their desire to grow this business, this newly created Mortgage Broker position will be focused on engaging new and existing customers which will involve advising them on loan strategy and finance plans. Whilst you will be provided warm leads, you will be expected to utilize your own existing networks to hunt and generate new business.


You will be part of the existing team that will assist you in marketing, mentoring and advice.

The more business you’re able to generate and write, the more support this organisation will provide you with.


You
To be successful within this position you will have:

  • A minimum of 2 years experience within a Mortgage Broking or Banking position
  • The ability to provide exceptional service to existing clients and further drive referral activity
  • Excellent communication and relationship building abilities
  • Self motivated and driven
  • A strong initiative and the ability to be proactive in generating new business
  • Excellent time management and organisational skills
  • A high level of integrity and honesty
  • Good computer skills
  • Demonstrated abilities to meet agreed targets
  • A Certificate IV - Mortgage Broking (ideally a Diploma in Mortgage Broking).


Contact Information

To find out more information about this opportunity, please APPLY NOW, or contact Jo and/or John Iskra on (03) 9725 5799

Additional information

  • Salary has a retainer plus commissions (negotiable)
  • Other longer term incentives available to the right candidate
  • Melbourne City

853636197:
[

Business Director - Sales & Business Development

Company Name The Working Party Company Location Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 233 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

The Working Party are seeking to hire a Business Director - Sales & Business Development.


The Working Party are the best Shopify Plus Partner in APAC - we provide strategy, design and growth services for high volume retailers. We only work with Shopify Plus - the most flexible, scalable and user friendly eCommerce platform on the market.


Our approach has achieved phenomenal success for many clients including Youfoodz, KOOKA\xcf, Honey Birdette, Lovisa, Saski Collection, Carbon Coco and Assembly Label. Our 100% commitment to Shopify Plus over all other platforms allows us to deliver the best possible result, pushing boundaries and making the impossible a reality.


We are looking for an experienced Business Director / Business Development Manager to join our fast growing team in Melbourne. You’ll report directly to the CEO, and work closely with our digital strategy, account management and production teams to ensure revenue and growth targets are met as well as upholding our values and strategic objectives.


You’ll have at least 3-4 years of experience working on pitches end to end, with C-suite level stakeholders, experience with SaaS and ideally in an agency environment. You’ll have a deep understanding of best practice in eCommerce - experience with Shopify /\xa0

\xa0and digital marketing will be very highly regarded.


The nitty gritty:

  • You will have a proven track record of pitching to and winning projects in an agency / ecommerce / SaaS environment.

  • You will have experience managing the end-to-end BD experience: qualification, requirements gathering, writing scope of work documents, proposal creating, pitching, closing and client onboarding.

  • You will build trust through knowledge and expertise and have a natural curiosity to continually further your own knowledge base as well and dig deeper into clients needs and an overall understanding of their business.

  • You will be a strategic, quick thinker and always be able to balance client requirements with our own commercial and strategic objectives.

  • You’ll have high financial business acumen and an ability to impact on metrics like margin and utilisation.

  • You’ll be comfortable working on inbound and outbound leads.

  • You’ll have experience working with pitches with multiple stakeholders - from different disciplines, for example CTO, CMO, CEO - and be able to tailor your approach accordingly.

  • You’ll be extremely organised, adept at juggling priorities - and have a solid understanding of tools of the trade such as task managers, project management tools, pipeline management and proposal software.

  • You’ll have an understanding of a range of eCommerce platforms, ERP’s, PIM’s as well as other tools such as apps, email marketing, inventory management etc.


About you:

  • You’ll jump at the opportunity to own this part of the business, and will look forward to hiring and developing the team as we continue to grow.

  • You’ll be proactive, approachable, collaborative and consistently able to deliver results.

  • You have at least one or two self taught skills in your tool kit and genuinely seek out continual learning opportunities both at and outside of work.

  • You’ll be a stickler for efficiency, attention to detail, best practice and pushing boundaries.

  • You’ll see opportunity everywhere, especially where others think it’s too hard.


More about us:

  • We work on custom made, birch ply Lean Open Desks and Steelcase Gesture chairs, or our own custom designed standing desks. On site secure bike parking and shower, 500m from train or tram.

  • Tech stack - latest Macbook Pro, LG 5K monitor and Apple accessories.

  • We have an enviable client list of some of APAC and Shopify’s best retailers, and a very high client retention rate.

  • We have a team of exceptional, talented professionals who work collaboratively to deliver the best results possible to our clients each and every time.

  • We love to nurture and develop our team as well as promote internally.

  • Our head office is in Melbourne, we have satellite offices in Sydney and Adelaide - our clients are all over APAC, this is a role that requires some travel.

  • We’re a social bunch and enjoy Friday night drinks, catered WIP’s and team events.


Salary offered will be commensurate with experience.


Please email your CV to\xa0work@theworkingparty.melbourne\xa0and include a cover letter outlining some successful projects you have worked on and some of your skills and values that would\xa0make this a good fit.


Direct applicants only (Australiand resident, or with full work rights).\xa0


With respect - no recruiters / no exceptions.
